name: Self Employed Women’s Association (SEWA)
services: Vocational training, micro-credit, cooperatives, financial inclusion, advocacy.
description: Founded 1972 by Ela Bhatt, SEWA empowers 3 million+ informal women workers for income security and leadership.

name: Swayam Shikshan Prayog (SSP)
services: Entrepreneurship training, micro‑finance, market access for women-led clean energy & agri businesses.
description: Supports 350 k+ rural women to build enterprises in energy, farming & health; UN-awarded.

name: Seva Bharati
services: Vocational training (handicrafts, tailoring, computers), cottage industry support.
description: Runs 1,400+ training centres for rural women’s skill development and entrepreneurship.

name: Parivartan Sandesh Foundation
services: Vocational training (‘Saksham Nari’) for unemployed urban women.
description: Empowers urban women with marketable skills, counselling & self‑employment support.

name: Kherwadi Social Welfare Association (Yuva Parivartan)
services: Vocational training in trades and handicrafts, entrepreneurship support.
description: Empowers marginalised youth & women in Mumbai slums via livelihood training.

name: Make Love Not Scars
services: Vocational training, legal aid, counselling for acid-attack survivors.
description: Helps survivors rebuild livelihood and confidence through skill training.

name: Stop Acid Attacks
services: Vocational rehab, legal support, skill workshops for survivors.
description: Supports acid attack survivors to gain financial independence.

name: Sabala Organization
services: Training Lambani women in embroidery, weaving, SHGs, microfinance.
description: Empowers tribal women via craft skills and self-help groups.

name: Sambhali Trust
services: Sewing & embroidery training, microfinance, boutique sales.
description: Supports Dalit women with vocational training and leadership.

name: All India Women’s Conference (AIWC)
services: Literacy, craft training, microcredit, solar-drier business for rural women.
description: Since 1927, AIWC works for women’s rights, education, entrepreneurship and health.

name: Digital Empowerment Foundation
services: Digital literacy, rural entrepreneurship training, digital microenterprises for women.
description: Empowers women through access to digital tools and ICT-based skill development in rural India.

name: Azad Foundation
services: Livelihood training for women to become professional drivers and entrepreneurs.
description: Trains resource-poor women for employment as drivers with feminist values of dignity, rights and inclusion.

name: Educate Girls
services: Education access, life skills and vocational readiness for adolescent girls.
description: Works in educationally backward districts to improve girl child education and vocational skill access.

name: Barefoot College
services: Solar engineering, business training for rural women, night school education.
description: Trains grandmothers and women from rural communities in solar entrepreneurship and livelihoods.

name: UDYOGINI
services: Entrepreneurship development, goatery, herbal products, and value chain training for women.
description: Supports tribal and rural women in becoming micro-entrepreneurs across sectors.

name: Aga Khan Rural Support Programme (India)
services: SHG formation, agriculture and entrepreneurship support for women farmers.
description: Facilitates rural development and women’s agency through livelihood training and SHGs.

name: Grameen Foundation India
services: Digital financial literacy, entrepreneurship for women SHGs, digital microfinance.
description: Helps women in underserved communities access credit, digital literacy, and business opportunities.

name: Navjyoti India Foundation
services: Women skill training in fashion design, beautician, computers and self-employment.
description: Founded by Dr. Kiran Bedi, provides education, skills and self-reliance support for women and youth.

name: Asha Kiran Society
services: Women and tribal livelihood development through sustainable enterprises.
description: Works in tribal Odisha to promote gender-inclusive business development and community leadership.

name: Vatsalya
services: Entrepreneurship, tailoring, beautician training for adolescent girls and women.
description: Focuses on women empowerment and skill development to promote financial independence.

name: Kalinga Institute of Social Sciences (KISS)
services: Vocational education and entrepreneurship training for tribal women and girls.
description: World’s largest residential institute for tribal children, supporting women’s economic inclusion.

name: ActionAid India
services: Livelihood training, SHGs, entrepreneurship for women in slums and rural areas.
description: Works to empower marginalized women with skills and self-help group enterprises.

name: Snehalaya
services: Vocational training and shelter for women rescued from trafficking and abuse.
description: Provides care, training and livelihood programs for women in distress and vulnerable groups.

name: Pradan
services: Supports SHG-based entrepreneurship in agriculture, poultry, and non-farm enterprises.
description: Facilitates economic self-reliance among tribal and rural women through SHGs and enterprise support.

name: Lend A Hand India
services: Vocational education in secondary schools with strong focus on girls and employment linkage.
description: Enables women and girls in secondary schools to access real-world livelihood training.

name: Gram Tarang Employability Training Services
services: Vocational training for tribal and rural youth, especially women.
description: Partners with NSDC and industry to deliver job-linked training to underserved populations.

name: Mahila Housing Trust
services: Entrepreneurship, climate resilience and financial literacy for low-income women.
description: Supports women-led housing, climate, and business initiatives in slums and low-income settlements.

name: Jatan Sansthan
services: Skill building for adolescent girls, menstrual health awareness, gender equity.
description: Rural NGO enabling girls to build confidence and self-reliance through vocational programs.

name: Vimochana
services: Women’s rights, livelihood training, advocacy, and support for domestic violence survivors.
description: One of India’s oldest feminist groups supporting women through rights-based livelihood support.

name: Apne Aap Women Worldwide
services: Education and skills for girls and women to exit prostitution and trafficking.
description: Empowers marginalised women and children through education, sewing, food processing and small business.

name: Breakthrough India
services: Gender rights, community media training for women, and leadership.
description: Trains young women as change leaders through communication, leadership and advocacy skills.

name: Goonj
services: Cloth for work, menstruation dignity, and rural entrepreneurship for women.
description: Provides women with tools and platforms to lead village development while earning income.

name: Shakti Shalini
services: Shelter, vocational skills, trauma healing, and business counselling for violence survivors.
description: Helps survivors of domestic abuse rebuild life through vocational and psychosocial support.

name: Vanangana
services: Leadership and microenterprise support for rural Dalit and tribal women.
description: Uses feminist empowerment to support women’s rights and livelihood initiatives.

name: Chaitanya WISE Project
services: Women entrepreneurship and SHG banking models.
description: Aims to build financial capacity of women-led self-help groups through training and incubation.

name: Jhpiego India
services: Health skills, digital health, women empowerment for ASHA workers and caregivers.
description: Helps women become para-health entrepreneurs using digital and technical training.

name: Sristi Foundation
services: Inclusive training for women with disabilities, organic farming and craft-based livelihoods.
description: Enables differently-abled women through farming, dairy and skill-based vocational models.

name: TIDE India
services: Green livelihoods and energy entrepreneurship for rural women.
description: Trains women in rural and tribal areas to become energy entrepreneurs with eco-tech tools.

name: Manjari Foundation
services: SHG-based business promotion, digital finance training and enterprise incubation.
description: Builds women’s collectives and SHGs to promote inclusive economic empowerment.

name: Bharatiya Yuva Shakti Trust (BYST)
services: Mentorship and business funding for underprivileged youth and women.
description: Promotes self-employment among youth and women through low-interest loans and expert mentoring.

name: SWATI
services: Training and marketing support for rural women in handicrafts, agriculture and food processing.
description: Creates SHG-led enterprises in tribal Odisha with backward and forward market linkages.

name: NavGurukul
services: Free coding education and employment pathways for underprivileged girls.
description: Helps girls from underserved communities break poverty cycles via full-time residential tech training.

name: Sakha Consulting Wings
services: Women chauffeur training and employment for vulnerable women.
description: Social enterprise enabling women to become professional drivers with dignity and security.

name: Samarpan Foundation
services: Vocational training for women in tailoring, jewelry making, and self-reliance programs.
description: Runs income-generation training for women in urban slums and semi-urban areas.

name: Majlis Legal Centre
services: Legal aid and vocational upskilling for domestic violence survivors.
description: Supports women with legal guidance and income-generating skills for reintegration.

name: Shanti Ashram
services: Vocational training, microfinance, and entrepreneurial support for rural women.
description: A Gandhian NGO advancing sustainable livelihoods through value-based entrepreneurship.

name: Lok Swasthya SEWA Trust
services: Health entrepreneurs, midwives and ASHA worker enterprise models.
description: Empowers women to deliver affordable health services while earning through trained entrepreneurship.

name: Maher Ashram
services: Shelter and income generation training for destitute and abandoned women.
description: Offers care and skill-based rehabilitation for women, enabling self-employment and dignity.

name: Janodaya Trust
services: Women-led hospitality enterprises, food production units and micro-credits.
description: Fosters inclusive economic empowerment through sustainable women-owned businesses.

name: Shakti Foundation
services: Microcredit, small business support, group enterprises for women.
description: Creates economic opportunities for underserved women through financial services and training.
